tags.name: Batch Read Operations
tags.description: Retrieve multiple records from the server.

tags.name: Cluster information operations
tags.description: Retrieve basic information about the Aerospike cluster.

tags.name: Info Operations
tags.description: Send info commands to nodes in the Aerospike cluster.

tags.name: Key Value Operations
tags.description: Perform simple operations on a single record.

tags.name: Operate operations
tags.description: Perform multiple operations atomically on a single record.

tags.name: Scan Operations
tags.description: Read records in specified namespace, set.

tags.name: Truncate Operations
tags.description: Remove multiple records from the server.

post.summary: Return multiple records from the server in a single request.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: allowInline
parameters.description: Allow batch to be processed immediately in the server's receiving thread when the server deems it to be appropriate.  If false, the batch will always be processed in separate transaction threads.  This field is only relevant for the new batch index protocol.

parameters.name: batchKeys
parameters.description: batchKeys

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentThreads
parameters.description: Maximum number of concurrent synchronous batch request threads to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 node/namespace combinations requested and maxConcurrentThreads is 8, then batch requests will be made for 8 node/namespace combinations in parallel threads. When a request completes, a new request will be issued until all 16 requests are complete.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: sendSetName
parameters.description:
Send set name field to server for every key in the batch for batch index protocol.
This is only necessary when authentication is enabled and security roles are defined on a per set basis.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

404.description: Non existent namespace used in one or more key.

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

post.summary: Perform multiple operations in background scan/query.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: commitLevel
parameters.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server.

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

parameters.name: durableDelete
parameters.description: If the transaction results in a record deletion, leave a tombstone for the record.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: Record expiration. Also known as ttl (time to live). Seconds record will live before being removed by the server.

parameters.name: generation
parameters.description: Expected generation. Generation is the number of times a record has been modified (including creation) on the server.

parameters.name: generationPolicy
parameters.description: Qualify how to handle record writes based on record generation.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: operations
parameters.description: An array of operation objects specifying the operations to perform on the record.

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: recordExistsAction
parameters.description: How to handle the existence of the record. This is ignored for POST/PUT/UPDATE kvs methods.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: respondAllOps
parameters.description: For client operate(), return a result for every operation.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries

post.summary: Create a new record with the provided bins into the record.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: bins
parameters.description:
Bins to be stored in the record. This is a mapping from a string bin name to a value. Value can be a String, integer, floating point number, list, map, bytearray, or GeoJSON value. Bytearrays and GeoJSON can only be sent using MessagePack
 example: {"bin1":5, "bin2":"hello", "bin3": [1,2,3], "bin4": {"one": 1}}

parameters.name: commitLevel
parameters.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server.

parameters.name: compress

parameters.description: Record expiration. Also known as ttl (time to live). Seconds record will live before being removed by the server.

parameters.name: generation
parameters.description: Expected generation. Generation is the number of times a record has been modified (including creation) on the server.

parameters.name: generationPolicy
parameters.description: Qualify how to handle record writes based on record generation.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Userkey for the record.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: maxRetries

Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: recordExistsAction
parameters.description: How to handle the existence of the record. This is ignored for POST/PUT/UPDATE kvs methods.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: respondAllOps
parameters.description: For client operate(), return a result for every operation.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout

Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

post.summary: Create a new record with the provided bins into the record.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: bins
parameters.description:
Bins to be stored in the record. This is a mapping from a string bin name to a value. Value can be a String, integer, floating point number, list, map, bytearray, or GeoJSON value. Bytearrays and GeoJSON can only be sent using MessagePack
 example: {"bin1":5, "bin2":"hello", "bin3": [1,2,3], "bin4": {"one": 1}}

parameters.name: commitLevel
parameters.description: Desired consistency guarantee when committing a transaction on the server.

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

parameters.name: durableDelete
parameters.description: If the transaction results in a record deletion, leave a tombstone for the record.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: Record expiration. Also known as ttl (time to live). Seconds record will live before being removed by the server.

parameters.name: generation
parameters.description: Expected generation. Generation is the number of times a record has been modified (including creation) on the server.

parameters.name: generationPolicy
parameters.description: Qualify how to handle record writes based on record generation.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Userkey for the record.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: recordExistsAction
parameters.description: How to handle the existence of the record. This is ignored for POST/PUT/UPDATE kvs methods.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: respondAllOps
parameters.description: For client operate(), return a result for every operation.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Set for the record; equivalent to database table.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

get.summary: Return multiple records from the server in a scan request.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: compress
parameters.description: Use zlib compression on command buffers sent to the server and responses received from the server when the buffer size is greater than 128 bytes.

parameters.name: concurrentNodes
parameters.description: Should scan requests be issued in parallel.

parameters.name: failOnClusterChange
parameters.description: Terminate scan if cluster in migration state. Only used for server versions < 4.9.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Next page token parameter.

parameters.name: includeBinData
parameters.description: Should bin data be retrieved. If false, only record digests (and user keys if stored on the server) are retrieved.

parameters.name: keytype
parameters.description: The Type of the userKey.

parameters.name: maxConcurrentNodes
parameters.description:
Maximum number of concurrent requests to server nodes at any point in time. If there are 16 nodes in the cluster and maxConcurrentNodes is 8, then scan requests will be made to 8 nodes in parallel.  When a scan completes, a new scan request will be issued until all 16 nodes have been scanned.
This field is only relevant when concurrentNodes is true.
parameters.default: 0 (issue requests to all server nodes in parallel)

parameters.name: maxRecords
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: maxRetries
parameters.description:
Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.
The initial attempt is not counted as a retry.
parameters.default: for read: 2 (initial attempt + 2 retries = 3 attempts), for write: 0 (no retries)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the record; equivalent to database name.

parameters.name: predexp
parameters.description: Optional predicate expression filter in postfix notation. If the predicate expression exists and evaluates to false, the transaction is ignored.

parameters.name: readModeAP
parameters.description: Read policy for AP (availability) namespaces. How duplicates should be consulted in a read operation. Only makes a difference during migrations and only applicable in AP mode.

parameters.name: readModeSC
parameters.description: Read policy for SC (strong consistency) namespaces. Determines SC read consistency options.

parameters.name: recordBins
parameters.description: Optionally specify a set of bins to return when fetching a record. If omitted, all bins will be returned.

parameters.name: recordsPerSecond
parameters.description:
Limit returned records per second (rps) rate for each server.
Do not apply rps limit if recordsPerSecond is zero.

parameters.name: replica
parameters.description: Replica algorithm used to determine the target node for a single record command.

parameters.name: scanPercent
parameters.description:
Percent of data to scan. Valid integer range is 1 to 100.
This field is supported on server versions < 4.9.
For server versions >= 4.9, use maxRecords.

parameters.name: sendKey
parameters.description: Send user defined key in addition to hash digest on both reads and writes.

parameters.name: sleepBetweenRetries
parameters.description: Milliseconds to sleep between retries.

parameters.name: socketTimeout
parameters.description: Socket idle timeout in milliseconds when processing a database command.

parameters.name: totalTimeout
parameters.description: Total transaction timeout in milliseconds.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

404.description: Namespace or set does not exist

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

delete.summary: Truncate records in a specified namespace.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
All records last updated before this date/time will be truncated. If not specified, all records will be truncated.
 This is a string representation of a date time utilizing the ISO-8601 extended offset date-time format. example: 2019-12-03T10:15:30+01:00

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace whose records will be truncated.

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

delete.summary: Truncate records in a specified namespace and set.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
All records last updated before this date/time will be truncated. If not specified, all records will be truncated.
 This is a string representation of a date time utilizing the ISO-8601 extended offset date-time format. example: 2019-12-03T10:15:30+01:00

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace whose records will be truncated

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: The set, in the specified namespace, whose records will be truncated

403.description: Not authorized to access the resource

500.description: The REST Client encountered an error processing the request

binNames.description: List of bins to limit the record response to.

readAllBins.description: Whether all bins should be returned with this record

record.description: Record associated with the key. Null if the record was not found

binNames.description: List of bins to limit the record response to.

readAllBins.description: Whether all bins should be returned with this record

digest.description: URL safe base64 encoded key digest. Returned by the server on batch responses. May be provided by client.

keytype.description: Enum describing the type of the userKey. This field is omitted in MessagePack responses.

userKey.description: The user key, it may be a string, integer, or URL safe Base64 encoded bytes.

operation.description: Aerospike operation to perform on the record

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in page.

bins.description: A mapping from binName to binValue

ttl.description: The time to live for the record, in seconds from now.

inDoubt.description: A boolean specifying whether it was possible that the operation succeeded. This is only included if true.

internalErrorCode.description: An internal error code for diagnostic purposes. This may be null

message.description: A message describing the cause of the error.

RestClientError.title: RestClientError
RestClientError.description: Error object returned from unsuccesful operations.

name.description: The name of the index. This must be unique per set

records.description: List of records for current page.
